name: Hydrogen
price_comment: Prices of hydrogen produced by distributed steam methane reforming, as predicted by H2A Production Model from United States Department of Energy,[9] assuming price of natural gas of US$3/MMBtu (US$10/MWh; US$0.10/m3). Does not include cost of storage and distribution.

name: Helium
price_comment: Crude helium sold to non-government users in United States in 2018. In the same year, stockpiles of US government helium were sold on auctions for average price of US$0.00989/L.[15]

name: Lithium
price_comment: Min. 99% pure.

name: Beryllium
price_comment: Min. 99% pure.

name: Boron
price_comment: In the form of boric acid, price per boron contained. Min. 99% pure.

name: Carbon
price_comment: In the form of anthracite, price per carbon contained, assuming 90% carbon content. There is a wide variation of price of carbon depending on its form. Lower ranks of coal can be less expensive, for example sub-bituminous coal can cost around US$0.038/kg carbon.[19] Graphite flakes can cost around US$0.9/kg carbon.[20] Price of synthetic industrial diamond for grinding and polishing can range from 1200 to 13300 USD/kg, while cost per weight of large synthetic diamonds for industrial applications can be on the order of million dollars per kilogram.[21]

name: Nitrogen
price_comment: As liquid nitrogen.

name: Oxygen
price_comment: As liquid oxygen.

name: Fluorine
price_comment: In the form of anhydrous hydrofluoric acid, price per fluorine contained. Range of prices on Chinese market, week of 1–7 December 2017.

name: Neon
price_comment: Approximate European price for buying small quantities.

name: Sodium
price_comment: Min 99.7% pure industrial grade sodium.

name: Magnesium
price_comment: Min 99.9% pure.

name: Aluminium
price_comment: High-grade primary aluminium, at London Metal Exchange warehouse.

name: Silicon
price_comment: Min. 99.1% pure, max. 0.4% iron, 0.4% aluminium, 0.1% calcium.[28] 10–100 mm.

name: Phosphorus
price_comment: Min. 99.9% pure yellow phosphorus.

name: Chlorine
price_comment: As chlorine is manufactured together with sodium hydroxide in chloralkali process, relative demand for one product changes the price for the other. When demand for sodium hydroxide is relatively high, chlorine price can fall to arbitrarily low levels, even to zero.[30]

name: Argon
price_comment: Liquid argon supply contract for University of Nevada, Las Vegas.

name: Potassium
price_comment: Min 98.5% pure industrial grade potassium.

name: Calcium
price_comment: Blocks of 98.5% pure calcium obtained by reduction process.

name: Scandium
price_comment: Min. 99.99% pure.

price_comment: Min. 99.6% pure titanium sponge.

price_comment: Min. 99.5% pure.

price_comment: Min. 99.2% pure.

price_comment: Electrolytic manganese, min. 99.7% pure.

name: Iron
price_comment: L8-10 pig iron. At Tangshan, China.

name: Cobalt
price_comment: Spot price. Min. 99.8% pure. At London Metal Exchange warehouse.

name: Nickel
price_comment: Primary nickel. Spot price. Min. 99.8% pure. At London Metal Exchange warehouse.

name: Copper
price_comment: Spot price. Grade A.[38] At London Metal Exchange warehouse.

name: Zinc
price_comment: Min. 99.995% pure special high grade zinc metal. Spot price. At London Metal Exchange warehouse.

name: Gallium
price_comment: Min. 99.99% pure. Free on Board China.

price_comment: Ingot. 50 Ω/cm.

name: Technetium-99m
price_comment: In the form of medical doses of sodium pertechnetate made on-site in technetium-99m generators. Price per technetium contained. Range of prices for medical doses available in the United States. Technetium-99m has half-life of 6 hours, which limits its ability to be directly traded.

name: Palladium
price_comment: 99.95% pure. London bullion market afternoon fix. In warehouse.

name: Silver
price_comment: 99.5% pure. Spot price. At London Metal Exchange warehouse.

name: Barium
price_comment: In the form of chemical-grade barite (barium sulfate) exported from China to United States. Price per barium contained, includes cost, insurance, and freight. Barium sulfate is the primary feedstock for production of barium chemicals.[50]

name: Lead
price_comment: Min. 99.97% pure. Spot price. At London Metal Exchange warehouse.

name: Bismuth
price_comment: Refined bismuth, min. 99.99% pure.

name: Astatine
price_comment: Only under a tenth of microgram of astatine has ever been produced.[44] Most stable isotope has half-life of 8.1 hours.

name: Radon
price_comment: Used in brachytherapy until 1960s,[59] currently radon is not used commercially.[60]

name: Francium
price_comment: Only quantities of the order of millions of atoms have been obtained for research.[61] Most stable isotope, 223Fr, has half-life of 22 minutes. Francium has no commercial or medical uses.[60]

name: Radium
price_comment: Radium was historically used in the treatment of cancer, but stopped being used when more effective treatments were introduced. As medical facilities had to pay for its disposal, its price can be considered negative.[62]

name: Thorium
price_comment: As 99.9% pure thorium oxide, price per thorium contained. Free on Board port of entry, duty paid.

name: Protactinium
price_comment: In 1959–1961 Great Britain Atomic Energy Authority produced 125 g of 99.9% pure protactinium at a cost of $500000, giving the cost of 4000000 USD per kg.[44] Periodic Table of Elements at Los Alamos National Laboratory website at one point listed protactinium-231 as available from Oak Ridge National Laboratory at a price of 280000 USD/kg.[64]

name: Uranium
price_comment: Mainly as triuranium octoxide, price per uranium contained.

name: Neptunium
price_comment: Periodic Table published by Pomona College Chemistry Department lists neptunium-237 as available from Oak Ridge National Laboratory at 660 USD/g plus packing costs.
